page.title: 18BRAYDON LAW AND ORDER
page.content: Undoubtedly the element of trust, probably arising from familiarity, is responsible for the sense of security. Some people still do not lock houses or cars, and generally there is a lesser fear of the growth in crime found in other, less rural communities. However, the publicity of crime in all its forms, causes apprehension. Even the growth of nearby villages is causing people to take precautions which up until now have been thought unnecessary. For instance, children are no longer allowed to ride their bicycles to villages, on their own, as their parents had done.
